I don't know how to deal with this kind of issue but I guess the cause is a floating point round error.

Implementation of torch.linspace is here. C++ code similar to this implementation shows exact same error.

#include <iostream>
#include <iomanip>

int main() {
  float b = 2.0 * 4099.0;
  float a = 0.0;
  int n = 4100;
  
  std::cout << std::setprecision(8);
  for (int i=4090; i<4100; i++) {
    std::cout << a + i * (b-a)/(float (n-1)) << std::endl;
  }
}

Output:

8180
8182
8184
8186
8188
8189.9995
8192
